Refinitiv 0.1.0.9004
  • Reference

    Build GET Query String

    build_get_query_string.Rd

    This function takes a named list (which may include NULL elements) and converts the non-NULL elements into a URL-encoded query string suitable for use in an HTTP GET request. All reserved characters (for example, spaces, colons) are encoded. If the input list is empty (or becomes empty after omitting NULL elements), the function returns an empty string.

    build_get_query_string(params)

    Arguments

    params

    A named list of parameters. Any element that is NULL is omitted.

    Value

    A character string representing the URL-encoded query string. If any parameters remain, the string is prepended with a "?".

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  query_list <- list(
    query    = "R:TSLA.O AND Language:EN",
    limit    = 5,
    dateFrom = "2023-01-01T00:00:00Z",
    extra    = NULL
  )
  qs <- build_get_query_string(query_list)
  # qs will be:
  # "?query=R%3ATSLA.O%20AND%20Language%3AEN&limit=5&dateFrom=2023-01-01T00%3A00%3A00Z"

  # Passing an empty list returns an empty string:
  build_get_query_string(list())
} # }
